intro: Cynanchum varians, commonly known as the variable milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually greenish-yellow with a reddish tinge, attracting various pollinators. Cynanchum varians is also known for its latex-containing stems, which can be toxic to livestock and humans if ingested.
